hints.content:
Each tick mark represents one minute.

Jules started eating lunch at $\greenD{1{:}06}$  and finished at $\redD{1{:}39}$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line labeled 1 o'clock to 1:45 with tick marks every 1 unit. A point labeled 1:06 appears 6 tick marks after 1 o'clock, and a point labeled 1:39 appears 9 ticks marks after 1:30. !

hints.content:
To find out how many minutes it took Jules to eat lunch, we can find the distance from $\greenD{1{:}06}$ to $\redD{1{:}39}$.

[[☃ image 1]]

$\begin{align}
\greenD{1{:}06} +{} &\purpleD{4}\text{ minutes} = 1{:}10\\\\
1{:}10 +{} & \goldE{20}\text{ minutes} = 1{:}30 \\\\
1{:}30 +{}&\blueD{9}\text{ minutes} = \redD{1{:}39}\\\\
\end{align}$

options.alt: A number line labeled 1:00 to 1:45 with tick marks every 1 unit. A series of three arrows are shown moving left to right from the 1:06 tick mark to the 1:39 tick mark. The first arrow starts at the 1:06 tick mark and ends at the 1:10 tick mark and is labeled plus 4. The second arrow starts at the 1:10 tick mark and ends at the 1:30 tick mark and is labeled plus 20. The third arrow starts at the 1:30 tick mark and ends at the 1:39 tick mark and is labeled plus 9. !

hints.content: It took Jules $33$ minutes to eat lunch.

question.content:
The number line shows when Jules $\greenD{\text{starts}}$ and $\redD{\text{finishes}}$ eating lunch.

[[☃ image 1]]

**How long did it take Jules to eat lunch?**  

[[☃ input-number 5]] minutes

options.alt: A number line labeled 1 o'clock to 1:45 with tick marks every 1 unit. A point labeled start appears 6 tick marks after 1 o'clock, and a point labeled finish appears 9 ticks marks after 1:30. !
